header: Criminal Bail Application No.54/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000217­2019 Mr. Saurabh Sunil Kakade …. Applicant. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent.

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.4 This is an application filed by the applicant for interim anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Cr. P. C. in C. R. No.660/2018 registered by Chaturshringi Police Station, under Section 420, 406 of the Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of cr. p. c.
under section 420, 406 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Even after notice to the respondent, Chaturshringi police station have not filed its say to the application on 09­01­ 2019 and also today. The learned APP submits that he has no instructions from the concerned police station. The learned advocate Mr. Tanpure for applicant submits that he has good case to argue. The prosecution under S. 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act is already launched against the accused and said fact is suppressed in the FIR. He further submits that the accused apprehends the arrest at the hands of police. Even after opportunity, police have not filed reply. Considering the submission made by the learned advocate for the accused, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Even after notice to the respondent, Chaturshringi police station have not filed its say to the application on 09­01­ 2019 and also today.
The learned APP submits that he has no instructions from the concerned police station.
The learned advocate Mr. Tanpure for applicant submits that he has good case to argue.
The prosecution under S. 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act is already launched against the accused and said fact is suppressed in the FIR.
He further submits that the accused apprehends the arrest at the hands of police.
Even after opportunity, police have not filed reply.
Considering the submission made by the learned advocate for the accused, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Saurabh Sunil Kakade in C. R. No. 660/2018, registered by Chaturshringi Police Station, under Section 420, 406 of the Indian Penal Code, applicant be released on his furnishing 2 P.R. Bond of Rs.30,000/­, with one or two sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicant shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicant shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and he shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation. [C] The applicant shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court and shall surrender his passport to the Investigating Officer. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till filing of the reply by the police. [3] The applicant shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Inform concerned police station accordingly.

footer: Pune, Dated/­ 14­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No.54/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000217­2019 Mr. Saurabh Sunil Kakade …. Applicant. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent. 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.4 This is an application filed by the applicant for interim anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Cr. P. C. in C. R. No.660/2018 registered by Chaturshringi Police Station, under Section 420, 406 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Even after notice to the respondent, Chaturshringi police station have not filed its say to the application on 09­01­ 2019 and also today. The learned APP submits that he has no instructions from the concerned police station. The learned advocate Mr. Tanpure for applicant submits that he has good case to argue. The prosecution under S. 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act is already launched against the accused and said fact is suppressed in the FIR. He further submits that the accused apprehends the arrest at the hands of police. Even after opportunity, police have not filed reply. Considering the submission made by the learned advocate for the accused, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Saurabh Sunil Kakade in C. R. No. 660/2018, registered by Chaturshringi Police Station, under Section 420, 406 of the Indian Penal Code, applicant be released on his furnishing 2 P.R. Bond of Rs.30,000/­, with one or two sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicant shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicant shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and he shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation. [C] The applicant shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court and shall surrender his passport to the Investigating Officer. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till filing of the reply by the police. [3] The applicant shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Inform concerned police station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
Pune, Dated/­ 14­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Shri. V. V. Bannur Name of Court : Shri. A. Y. Thatte, District Judge 14 and ASJ, Pune. Judgment signed by PO on : ­ 14­1­2019 Judgment uploaded on :­ 16­1­2019
